result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan A Ferrise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to operate unless properly licensed.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Logan A Ferrise in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel needs to check with DVM before he enters a plea to this charge and requests a short adjournment. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Adjournment request filed by Attorney Raskopf

Approved by Judge Maxwell 1/7/16

Defendant Logan A Ferrise in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to get into treatment. State has no objections. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Logan A Ferrise in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for 30 days. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Logan A Ferrise in court with attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Logan A Ferrise not in court.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
